messages.subject: Re: Its over
messages.msgSnippet: Tia, I am so sorry for your loss :(  The fact that you want to share it here hopefully means you have found a good place of support and friendship. Olga ...
messages.messageBody:
Tia,

I am so sorry for your loss :( The fact that you want to share it
here hopefully means you have found a good place of support and
friendship.

Olga

> > Of course she had to go and die while I was travelling home.
> > They told me she might do that. I guess it's common. I had just
been
> > hoping she would die while I was there because I really wanted to
hold her
> > in my arms for a few minutes. I couldn't do that while she was
alive
> > because it would have caused too much pain.
>

messages.subject: Its over
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/5/2003 11:32:25 PM Central Daylight Time, ... I ve been thinking about my Mom a lot lately Tia, your post made me cry. It was a good cry
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/5/2003 11:32:25 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
> Of course she had to go and die while I was travelling home.
> They told me she might do that. I guess it's common. I had just been
> hoping she would die while I was there because I really wanted to hold her
> in my arms for a few minutes. I couldn't do that while she was alive
> because it would have caused too much pain.

I've been thinking about my Mom a lot lately Tia, your post made me cry. It
was a good cry though, thinking of you being there with your Mom so much.
I'm sorry she left this earth when you weren't with her. The one night I
finally went up to my parents house for a shower and some real food, my Mom died.
I still am sad about it sometimes.
I'm glad she doesn't have to hurt or be afraid anymore.
But I'm sorry you don't have your Mom with you.
((((((((((((((((Tia))))))))))))))))))))))))

Ren


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
